page.title: 17Cheriton Fitz.Social Caring
page.content: A high level of social concern is displayed by commitment to{political {parties}and{voluntary organisations}, to formal voluntary service like Meals on Wheels and Hospital Car Service and to much informal neighbourly help. A telephone network links the able bodied, for calling out to{emergencies such as fire, flood, snow or accident. The parish bought a ladder for use by this group. Fine Elizabethan almshouses have been sold and the proceeds invested for charitable purposes. They have been superceded by a grant of a{Council sheltered {bungalows, with phone}lines to a Warden. Before 1965 a{policeman}lived in the police house which is now privately owned.{Police officers}from Crediton are on call and also patrol in cars.
